New Records: Pakistan scored 185/9, their fifth-highest score against South Africa and highest at the World Cup.
Shadab Khan scored his first T20I fifty.
Mohammad Haris made his debut, taking crucial catches.
Shaheen Afridi took his 50th T20I wicket.
Key Match Events: Pakistan recovered from 95/5 to post a competitive score.
South Africa's top-order struggles led to quick dismissals.
DLS method was used due to rain, adding complexity to the chase.
Shadab Khan removed key batsmen Bavuma and Markram.
Last-over heroics by Pakistan's bowlers sealed the win.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan aimed to maintain their strong record against South Africa.
South Africa focused on ending Pakistan's dominance.
Mohammad Haris replaced Fakhar Zaman due to injury.
Pakistan's batting order included Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan players expressed pride in their resilience.
The win was seen as pivotal for their tournament journey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interruptions and DLS method influenced the match flow.
Historical context of Pakistan's strong record against South Africa.
Others: Kagiso Rabada's performance and the pace bowlers' battle were significant.
